I spent today exploring around the

complete all the Pacific nations I
thought now would be a great time to
share with you of my six favorite things
about the Pacific one Island time
anywhere you go in the Pacific no one's
in a rush no one's in a hurry it's so
relaxing it's so laid-back it's just a
simple life everybody wakes up every
morning does the same routine lays on
the hammock just relax
to beaches of course anywhere you go in
the Pacific you can expect to see
amazing beaches and I promise you they
will live up to the expectations
everywhere you go you will see white
sanded Beach crystal-clear seawater
amazing for snorkeling and diving it's
just an unbelievable paradise and don't
forget to drink a fresh coconut in the
sand three indigenous cultures one of my
favorite things about traveling the
Pacific is that there's real indigenous
culture here you can find people that
have been living on the same land for
thousands and thousands of years which
means they have their traditional food
traditional dances rituals drinks
religion all that stuff is deeply rooted
here and it's really amazing to go into
villages and see how people live for its
English speaking so this is anywhere you
go in the Pacific people can speak
English most of them fluently
of course you have the British in the
American Colonization but even otherwise
in the schools and everything people are
trying to learn English all the signs
are in English you never have to worry
about a communication barrier which is
honestly one of the best parts about
being a traveler and coming to this part
of the world five scuba diving and
snorkeling if there's any divers out
there you have to come to the Pacific
they have some of the clearest water
some of the most diverse marine life and
if you're a snorkel or you can pretty
much walk off any Beach stick your
goggles in the water and see an
abundance of fish and there's also a lot
of shipwrecks here from world war ii
which is super interesting to see six
World War two history as I just
mentioned is a bunch of Japanese
shipwreck dive but also on land the
Japanese conquered most of the Pacific
and the Americans were battling with
them here on these islands and you can
see relics cannons and guns and
ammunition just laying around the
islands they're just original they're
natural no one ever cared for them
they're just there and it really gives
you this cool feeling and I'm not even a
history nerd but coming here got me a
lot more interested in World War two and
if you like history then this is the
perfect place for you okay so now that
you've heard my favorite things about
the Pacific I'd like to end with some
general travel tips if you're coming to
this region number one is book all your
flights in advance because they sell out
and they get really really expensive
[Music]
there's three major airlines that will
connect all of these islands which is
Fiji and New Zealand and Nauru air if
you jump on that were here you can take
the hopper which means they'll just go
from country to country and it'll be
cheaper to break up your trip that way
which is exactly what I did but
definitely make sure that you buy all
your stuff in advance because it can get
really pricey next make sure that you
have a lot of US Dollars and Australian
dollars with you at all times
because there are not many ATMs here and
a lot of these countries take either US
Dollars all of Micronesia is US Dollars
and Kiribati Nauru and Tuvalu take the
Aussie dollar next you guys have to have
patience when you come here it's so
relaxed it's so laid-back and this is
something that I struggle with having a
DD and I'm always like boom boom boom
gotta get everyone on time but know if
they tell you the bus is 20 minutes it's
40 minutes just to relax everybody's
smiling welcome to some more it's very
safe I haven't really mentioned the
safety aspect here I've never had any
issues while traveling in the Pacific
but just make sure that you just relax
yourself and have patience the food what
about the food here honestly it's not
really that great don't have high
expectations there's really good tuna
and fish and rice which is their staple
food but they don't really grow crops
there's not many fruits and vegetables
on these islands especially the atoll
remote islands so a lot of this imported
canned food like frozen pizzas and
canned corn and canned green beans but
there is a lot of Chinese restaurants
here for one reason or another so I ate
a lot of Chinese food but yeah I don't
have too high of expectations for the
cuisine and finally my last tip is how
to get Wi-Fi how to get signal long
story short the Wi-Fi is really slow and
it's not really available so your best
bet is to get local SIM cards in each
country as soon as you arrive in the
airport pop over to the local SIM card
provider usually Digicel and they'll
hook you up with an awesome rate it's
usually about 20 US dollars for two
gigabytes which I found to be enough to
upload everything and also you can
hotspot your computer which means you
can use your computer as well so that's
all my tips I really hope you guys is it
the Pacific it's an amazing part of the
